item.title: Senior Manager- Venture Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager- Venture Analytics

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of organization – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives. We are building a world class team focused on creating new experiences, exploring new business models and developing new relationships that add value to how people live and work. 

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members to find innovative solutions.

What is the opportunity?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.

  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.

  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modeling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.

  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must Have:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).

  • 3+ years of SQL (for analyses & creating reports) with additional experience in predictive analytics (R, Python, etc.).

  • Experience with complex, large-scale relational databases, and statistical programs, with an aptitude to adapt and implement additional technical applications or tools

  • Experience managing data tools/platforms and hosting team-based knowledge sharing sessions

  • Proven track record of communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.

  • Ability to inform and influence stakeholders cross-functionally through data, building relationships, while communicating early and often

  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.
     

Nice to Have:

  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a big plus.

  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)
     

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits

  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

 RBCVentures

 #LI-Hybrid

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Ventures

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-07-07-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-08-15-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Director, IA Analytics Ecosystem
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, IA Analytics Ecosystem

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Director, IA Analytic Ecosystem, you will be accountable for the development of data products and services that span across all platforms in Internal Audit. The role creates new and innovative ways to leverage data across all of RBC’s businesses for new opportunities.  The role defines, supports and informs business strategies through the breakdown, analysis and understanding of vast amounts of data, both internal and external to RBC.  Provides engagement and leadership to a development team so they can deliver big data solutions for critical applications and regulatory requirements. Interacts with senior leaders to ensure that business value is being generated from the set of enterprise data services that the director is responsible for.


The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

What will you do?  

  • Strong Collaboration and Stakeholder management. Partner with Internal Audit Product Owners and Data Leads to understand business objectives and technology requirements in order to lead, support and recommend solutions that add business value, both current and future
  • Lead and execute Proof of Concept (POC) for new technologies and present feedback, recommendation and/or final decisions
  • Lead and evolve Audit Data Domain custodianship through automation for data catalogue, data lineage and data quality  integration with CDO data governance platform
  • Lead the upkeep and maintenance of the Ecosystem infrastructure, analytics process and ensuring technology currency
  • Develop new and evolve current analytics capabilities and standards to ensure efficiencies and effectiveness in IA data management and analytics practice.
  • Lead and actively pursue innovation and ideation. Present opportunities and proposed architecture to senior leadership and lead the build out of those opportunities.
  • Lead and actively pursue automation opportunities to drive Audit efficiencies
  • Demonstrate leadership presence: Establish credibility by demonstrating subject matter expertise and knowledge in process excellence, be confident, authentic and effective, respect diversity and coach others, connect and engage stakeholders, build rapport, build strong relationships subject matter experts

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have 

  • Undergraduate degree    (e.g. B.Com., B. Math, P. Eng., MSc (Data Science)
  • Extensive experience in a big data environment with a focus on end to end medium/large project development
  • Exceptional development expertise using Python/APIs/JS/HTML/DAO
  • Exceptional knowledge of Database technologies SQL. Hadoop and Data Engineering tools e.g. Dataiku, Data stage and Data Visualization tools e.g. Tableau
  • Strong knowledge for creation of automated unit tests, integration, end-to-end testing and DevOps practices (E.g. CI/CD).
  • Undergraduate STEM degree (e.g. B.Sc, P. Eng.)

Nice-to-have 

  • Post-Graduate coursework e.g., (MSc in Data Science)
  • Functional knowledge of Predictive Analytics and Statistical Modelling (using R and/or Python)
  • A good sense of UX/UI design and visualization for translating business user stories to working prototypes with HTML5/CSS,Plot.ly ,D3 JavaScript libraries

What’s in it for you? This is standard

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make lasting through Business value generation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

item.title: Manager, Reporting and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Manager, Analytics and Reporting is responsible for the execution of a data and analytics strategy that delivers key insights in alignment with the function’s goals. You will leverages expertise in business strategy, analytics, data science, and visualization techniques to further enable risk-based reporting by identifying credit risks in the various global and U.S. credit portfolios. You wil also be accountable for the implementation of reporting and analytics that will provide continuous improvements to Credit Risk Review and IA Wholesale Credit Risk teams.

Maintains an awareness of and ongoing assessment of common technology practices, to ensure business value is generated from technology solutions, which serves to enhance 3rd line level of assurance and insights. Recommend use of technology for continued enhancement of internal practices to improve levels of efficiency and exploration of expansion of technology capabilities to strengthen transaction and portfolio analysis. Leverages expertise in analytics, data science, and visualization techniques to further enable risk-based reporting by identifying credit risks in the various global and U.S. credit portfolios.

What will you do?

  • Execute all foundational data & analytics initiatives that support all U.S. Credit Risk Review workflows including Target Reviews, Continuous Monitoring Reviews, Risk Assessments, Regulatory, Internal Senior Management and Board Committee reporting
  • Extract, transform, and load client/loan data from Credit Client Management System (CCMS), Newton and other related systems in order to provide updated credit portfolio data to the U.S. CRR team members
  • Assist in the implementation / recommendation of new data analytics and enhanced reporting in support of review planning and execution
  • Assist in the implementation / recommendation of new automation opportunities to create efficiencies 
  • Ensure Metric Stream is maintained for any applicable U.S. CRR activities (e.g. issue tracking)
  • Strong and committed team player, having the ability to deal with the changing needs of the function through effective teamwork and communication; Manage personal skill development by planning future career growth; Participate in cross-training initiatives
  • Work closely with Internal Audit (IA) credit teams (e.g. Wholesale Credit and Credit Risk CoE) to assist in data & analytics initiatives that support wholesale, commercial, wealth management, and retail credit audits.
  • Collaborate with the Internal Audit Data Management & Analytic team to gain insights from the use of data analytics across the audit function.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • university, or post-graduate degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Finance, Economics, Engineering or Math
  • Exceptional experience in data analytics cycle (ETL, data modeling, analytics, and reporting)
  • Proficient in Python, SQL , Data visualization and reporting – e.g. Tableau, Excel

Nice-to-have

  • Experience working with a credit risk review/credit or loan approval function within a Financial Institution
  • Experience in an Internal Audit function (ideally within a Financial Institution)
  • Experience with Predictive Analytics and Statistical Modelling (using R and/or Python) and associated tools ( e.g. RStudio and/or Jupyter) a plus
  • 2+ years’ experience working as a Business / Technical Systems Analyst in a highly analytical environment

What’s in it for you?    

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Salaried

item.title: CFG Sales Strategy and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

CFG Sales Strategy and Analytics

Job Description

  • Assist with the development and implementation of customer account plans and strategies

  • Assist with implementing best practices to support consistent, consultative sales and client success processes
  • Assist with monitoring KPIs and sales metrics
  • Collaborate with business management, technology, finance, data management teams to develop bespoke reporting and dashboards
  • Gather data quickly and respond in oral and written format to senior sales people and client info requests
  • Interface with internal groups to organize meetings and coordinate presentation material content
  • Conduct on-going sales opportunity analysis
  • Work to ensure sales feedback is incorporated into reporting
  • Record client activities and opportunities in CRM systems
  • Assist in preparing periodic business updates for review with senior management.
  • Work collaboratively with partners within RBC to meet clients’ needs and objectives

Job Summary

Support the Central Funding sales organization across client facing verticals and work in partnership with Capital Markets businesses and Functions to achieve our strategic objectives. RBC Capital Market’s Central Funding Group (“CFG”) operates a global secured finance business providing short-term funding secured by collateral - typically fixed income and equity securities.

The role covers a broad range of activities/ responsibilities to support senior sales efforts, including the production of marketing material, preparing material for client meetings (internal and external), developing account plans and tracking follow ups to ensure client success.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2022-07-18-07:00

2022-08-31-07:00

item.title: Senior Manager, Data and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data and Analytics

Job Description

  • Supports leadership in the execution of operational frameworks, processes and tools, and utilization of organizational change management practices to drive support and empower staff in assigned unit. 
  • Manages the activities of a team within the unit, enabling the team to meet objectives, implement changes to processes, tools, and methods that result in increased agility and cost reductions within the unit. 
  • The role is to lead and manage a team to execute network instrumentation.  This includes developing analytic models to predict impacts on network bandwidth, network security, and network device configurations.
  • The team works closely with internal and external service and business partners in the development of technology strategies that enable agile implementation, service improvement, and service assurance.
  • Accountable for availability, design, and implementation of the network instrumentation solutions for the global enterprise.

Job Summary

Manages the design, implementation and maintenance of data collection and analytics for large telecommunication networks within and beyond the enterprise. Typically manages 2 or more specialized departments comprised of supervisors, managers, professionals, and/or large numbers of operational support employees.

item.title: Product Manager, Data & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Product Manager, Data & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Working with the front office Digital Platform and Analytics Product Development team to drive end to end product delivery. This role can be at the Director level or Senior Manager (VP Capital Markets) level depending on qualifications and experience of the successful candidate

What will you do?

  • Work closely with the technology and engineering teams to help develop, communicate and implement an efficient product roadmap

  • Bring concepts and ideas to reality and bridge technical, business and creative worlds through collaboration, client focus and partnership, and working closely with all our functions (Technology/Development, Engineering, Compliance, Legal, Sales, Marketing) to evolve the Platform

  • Drive the execution of high-level product roadmaps into features and product delivery with end to end responsibility for actively managing and growing new products on our Digital Platform

  • Formulate a clear, coherent product strategy and drive it forward, getting buy-in from Leadership and stakeholders across the Platform

  • Understand and develop a deep understanding of customer use cases to drive client focused value creation across the Digital Platform

  • Evaluate and document the requirements for product features, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade off decisions as needed

  • Create internally and externally facing decks to help educate stakeholders on our strategy and product

  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans

  • Work with the leadership team on articulating product value proposition and product positioning

What do you need to succeed?

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or other quantitative disciplines and/or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years of relevant professional experience in Technology and/or Finance

  • Experience working with Data Science teams

  • Experience in Artificial Intelligence and machine learning techniques

  • High degree of strategic and innovative thinking

  • Strong communication skills and ability to communicate credibly and persuasively with the broader organization

  • Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and verbal communication skills to demonstrate thought leadership

  • Experience in driving product strategy and leading technology transformation

  • Must have ability to work comfortably across various functional teams

  • Knowledge of industry trends and emerging technologies

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and opportunities to learn & develop professionally

  • Work closely with and maintain positive working relationships with broader Capital Markets teams and with other areas of the bank.

item.title: Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing and financial modelling
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies and playbooks
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field is preferred but not required (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.)
  • Previous experience in a Finance role (Corporate Treasury, Funds Transfer Pricing)
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity models

Job Summary

As the Senior Manager, Pricing and Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and management of pricing strategies to drive profitable growth and increased market share for the Personal Lending (PL) portfolios. The Senior Manager of Pricing and Analytics is responsible for the development and end-to-end implementation of pricing strategies, including providing actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

item.title: Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics will implement stress testing components and participate in risk management analytics and processes to minimize credit risk. The ideal candidate will apply extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

What will you do?

  • Develops and maintains tools used for the implementation and execution of credit risk models. These models are used in the measurement of Expected Credit Loss (ECL), Provision for Credit Losses, and RWA for internal and regulatory stress testing.
  • Execute the production of stress testing projections for internal and regulatory filings.
  • Identify ECL production challenges and conducts independent problem solving to resolve proficiently.
  • Communicate results and analyses to management and key stakeholders.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Experience with SAS & Python programming
  • Experience with data analytics
  • Knowledge of credit products in the financial industry

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with statistical modelling of credit products
  • Experience with stress testing programs in the financial industry

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Implements stress testing components and participates in risk management analytics and processes to minimize credit risk. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

item.title: Manager, Data Analytics, HR Governance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics, HR Governance

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Manager, Data Analytics, HR Governance position will coordinate and manage data-related requirements within the HR Governance team. You will be a subject matter expert regarding data and data analysis and will maintain accurate data relating to regulatory requirements (such as SMCR and Whistleblowing) and provide accurate, user-friendly MI for senior management forums. You will utilise data and data analytics expertise to provide advice on, and implement, enhancements to how data is stored, maintained, updated and reported on.

What will you do?

Whistleblowing and Retaliation Monitoring

  • Regular and ad-hoc reporting and data analysis requirements, this will include quarterly reports to HRC and SMFs, grievances and retaliation monitoring, quarterly analysis of new and emerging trends on employee concerns for WBC and Trend Analysis Forum, quarterly reports to Enterprise ER on cases and retaliation monitoring
  • Routine retaliation monitoring, including bi-weekly monitoring of leavers, redundancies, PIPs and disciplinaries, monthly monitoring of changes to reporting lines, job mandates and remuneration, year-end monitoring of performance ratings (YoY and peer group comparison), monthly retaliation monitoring report for Head of HR and Whistleblowing Champion
  • Monitoring completion of online training for people managers
  • Bi-weekly testing of the WB reporting line
  • Monitoring of implementation of recommendations made as part of investigations

Senior Manager & Certification Regime (SMCR)

  • Assistance with Workday design/implementation relating to SMCR requirements
  • Regular auditing of data changes (made by other HR Governance team members) within a variety of systems to ensure accuracy
  • Weekly Business Manager attestation process to capture changes to SMCR population, and upload of changes to FCA Register
  • Monthly reporting and data analysis for SMCR Management Committee and SMCR Oversight Forum
  • Super-user for Trailight tool to make system changes and updates
  • Manage 30 day travel process to identify potential overseas visitors who are in scope for SMCR
  • Assistance with year-end Annual F&P review and MiFID K&C reviews including monitoring of, and reporting on, completion of various elements of the F&P process (self-attestations, manager attestations, background screening) and issuing annual F&P certificates
  • Review and approve regulated background screening reports
  • Monthly mapping of SMF\'s and other regulatory roles

HR Department Risk

  • BCP
  • Tracking audit points & other recommendations/improvements

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Proven experience of data analytics in a regulated environment
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Proven ability to present data in an attractive and user-friendly way, including advanced PowerPoint skills

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of local regulations, such as SMCR and Whistleblowing
  • Knowledge and experience of databases such as Tableau, Workday and ADP

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible working options fully supported

Job Summary

London, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
